problems.title: Hollow Diamond Number Border
problems.description:
Print a hollow diamond pattern of size (2*N-1) using digits. The border of the diamond should contain the row number, and the interior should be spaces.

Input Format:
A single integer N representing the size.

Output Format:
Print a hollow diamond of height (2*N-1). On row i (1-based), let r = i for i <= N, and r = 2*N - i for i > N. Only the first and last non-space positions in that row should contain digit r; the rest of the interior should be spaces.
hintsList: Use two halves: top (1 to N) and bottom (N-1 down to 1). For each row compute leading spaces and the positions of the two border digits.

problems.title: Concentric Number Rectangle
problems.description:
Print a (2*N-1) x (2*N-1) square where numbers form concentric rectangles. The outermost border is N, the next inner border is N-1, and so on until 1 at the center.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print a (2*N-1) x (2*N-1) matrix of integers separated by a single space.
hintsList: For each cell (i, j) in the (2*N-1)x(2*N-1) grid, compute its distance from the closest border and derive the value as N - distance.

problems.title: Pascal Triangle Centered
problems.description:
Print the first N rows of Pascal's triangle, centered using spaces.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print N rows of Pascal's triangle. Each row's numbers are separated by a single space and the triangle is centered by leading spaces.
hintsList: Use a 2D array or iterative formula C(n,k) = C(n-1,k-1) + C(n-1,k). Compute row by row and add leading spaces based on remaining rows.

problems.title: Spiral Number Matrix
problems.description:
Print an N x N matrix filled with numbers from 1 to N^2 in clockwise spiral order, starting from the top-left corner.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print an N x N matrix with numbers separated by a single space.
hintsList: Use boundaries (top, bottom, left, right) and fill the matrix layer by layer while moving in four directions: right, down, left, up.

problems.title: Butterfly Star Number Pattern
problems.description:
Print a butterfly pattern of height 2*N using stars (*) and the row index as a number at the center. For rows 1 to N, each row i has i stars on the left, then spaces, then digit i, then the same number of spaces, then i stars on the right. For rows N+1 to 2*N, the pattern mirrors from N-1 down to 1 with the appropriate digit.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print 2*N rows of the described butterfly pattern.
hintsList: Handle top (1..N) and bottom (N-1..1) halves separately. For each row, compute number of stars on both sides and central spaces around the digit.

problems.title: Zigzag Number Pattern (3 Rows)
problems.description:
Given N, print a zigzag pattern with 3 rows using digits from 1 to N (wrapping to 1 after 9). Characters are placed in 3 rows as if writing in a zigzag: row1 -> row2 -> row3 -> row2 -> row1 -> ... Remaining positions are spaces.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print 3 rows. Place the k-th digit at the appropriate row and column; other positions should be spaces.
hintsList: Simulate the zigzag: maintain current row (0,1,2) and direction (down or up). Use a 2D char grid and fill digits, leaving other cells as spaces.

problems.title: Symmetric Palindromic Pyramid
problems.description:
Print a centered numeric pyramid where each row is a palindromic sequence that expands outwards, using digits from 1 up to the row number and back to 1.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
On row i (1-based), first print (N-i) spaces, then the sequence 1 2 ... i-1 i i-1 ... 2 1 with no spaces between digits.
hintsList: For each row i, print (N-i) spaces, then an increasing sequence from 1 to i, then a decreasing sequence from i-1 back to 1.

problems.title: Hourglass Star Pattern with Hollow Center
problems.description:
Print an hourglass pattern made of '*' of height (2*N-1). The top is an inverted pyramid, the bottom is a regular pyramid. There must be a hollow center column of spaces, except the very top and bottom rows, which are fully filled with stars.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print (2*N-1) rows, each of length (2*N-1).
hintsList: Treat top and bottom halves separately. Use two pointers for left and right star positions that move inward (top) and outward (bottom) while keeping the center column as spaces except first and last rows.

problems.title: Diagonal Wave Pattern
problems.description:
Print an N x N grid with digits forming a wave on the main and anti-diagonals. The main diagonal has values from 1 to N (top-left to bottom-right); the anti-diagonal has values from N to 1 (top-right to bottom-left). All other cells should be '.' (dot). If a cell lies on both diagonals (the center when N is odd), print the main diagonal value.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print N rows, each with N characters: either digit (1-9) or '.'. No spaces between characters.
hintsList: For each cell (i, j), if i == j place (i+1), if i + j == N-1 place (N-i), otherwise '.'. When both diagonals meet (center), prefer the main diagonal value.

problems.title: Number Rhombus Border
problems.description:
Print a rhombus (tilted square) of side N using digits on the border and spaces inside. The rhombus is centered and has height (2*N-1). On each border cell, print the distance (1-based) from the top vertex along the perimeter, modulo 10 (0-9). Interior cells are spaces.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print a rhombus of height (2*N-1) using digits and spaces only.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3

Sample Output (one valid numbering)
  1
 2 3
4   5
 6 7
  8
hintsList: Compute the coordinates of the four edges of the rhombus and walk around its perimeter, assigning increasing numbers modulo 10. Use spaces for interior points not on the perimeter.
